article.para: In order to improve the chance of continued funding for the InterMine project it would be really appreciated if anyone that uses InterMine or parts of InterMine would let us know. Just drop a quick email to info[at]intermine.org.
InterMine is open-source software, available for download and use under the terms of the GNU LGPL licence.
The source code can be obtained via a download, or via anonymous CVS.

sect1.title: Downloading the source code
sect1.para: The source code can be downloaded as either an official release, or a nightly build. You will find files starting from intermine-src, intermine-tutorial and flymine-src, they are intermine source code, intermine tutorial source code and flymine source code respectively. You can download depending on your needs.
The source code is available in tar.gz or ZIP format.
Official releases - this is where the official InterMine release appear. Official releases are planned to occur every couple of months, on average.

Nightly build - this is a snapshot of the InterMine source code taken last night. This will work, but may be in a state of flux, and with portions undocumented, or not conforming to the documentation.

sect1.title: Obtaining source code via anonymous CVS access
sect1.para: Anonymous CVS access to the InterMine source code is via our public CVS server, cvs.flymine.org. This server contains a read-only snapshot of the CVS source the software developers are using, updated every 10 minutes.

itemizedlist.listitem: cd to the directory into which you intend to check out the source.
Issue the command cvs -d :pserver:anonymous@cvs.flymine.org:/cvs login. No password is needed.

sect1.para: Once you have checked out the source from the CVS server, the command cvs update will obtain any updates to the code made by the development team. You should issue this command regularly.
